borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <div><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The proposed development by reason of excessive massing and scale&nbsp;is regarded an overdevelopment to the property.&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">Therefore, the proposed development is considered harmful to the appearance of the house and character of the area.&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">&nbsp;</span>As such, the proposed development is contrary to:<br></div><div><br></div><div>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</div><div>- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</div><div>- Policies SP 2, DMD 1 and DMD 6&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 11pt;">(Regulation 19 Consultation&nbsp;Version, October 2020);</span></div><div>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</div><div>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012).</div>

<div>The scale, siting and design of the&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">proposed first floor rear extension and&nbsp;two storey side extension</span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">&nbsp;</span>would result in an increased sense of overbearingness and a harmful loss of outlook, privacy and daylight to no 19 and 21 East Road, therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:<br></div><div><br></div><div>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</div><div>- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</div><div>- Policies DMD 1 and DMD 6 of the Draft Local Plan&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 11pt;">(Regulation 19 Consultation&nbsp;Version, October 2020);</span></div><div>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</div><div>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012).</div>

<div><span style="font-size: 11pt;">The proposed two storey side extension by reason of irregular design disrupts the appearance of the original dwellinghouse and wider street scene.&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">The proposed two storey side extension introduces an&nbsp;additional door on the front elevations</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">&nbsp;which is&nbsp;highly disruptive in design to the street scene.&nbsp;The proposed two storey side extension also results in&nbsp;a hip to gable roof extension which destroys the characteristic pitched roof of the original dwellinghouse and disrupts the uniformity in roofscape within the street scene.&nbsp;In addition, the&nbsp;proposed side extension&nbsp;closes a gap within the street scene and fails to</span><span style="font-size: 14.6667px;">&nbsp;appear subordinate to the dwellinghouse. Therefore, the proposed two storey side extension is considered harmful to the appearance of the house and character of the area.&nbsp;</span>As such, the proposed development is contrary to:<br></div><div><br></div><div>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</div><div>- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</div><div>- Policies SP 2, DMD 1 and DMD 6&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 11pt;">(Regulation 19 Consultation&nbsp;Version, October 2020);</span></div><div>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</div><div>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012).</div>
description: Construction of a two storey side extension and a part two storey part single storey rear extension with a first floor Juliette balcony.
